subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 5, Lambas and Fundamentals
msgSnippet: ... If you were to replace Class[] in Category with Object[] and call toString() on those, would that work? ... IDE and build system support would be the best
messageBody:
> I'd also take quite seriously any recommendations for how we could enable
> string-based category names without breaking existing users.
>
>
If you were to replace Class[] in Category with Object[] and call
toString() on those, would that work?


> The vast majority of tests are run either through IDEs or build systems,
> which, as far as I've seen, always bypass the command-line processing
> functionality of JUnitCore in order to implement their own graphical or
> XML-based configuration system. So adding command-line options to
> JUnitCore has become rather low-priority in my book, since it would help
> such a small percentage of users.
>
>
IDE and build system support would be the best goal I guess. Perhaps a JVM
option such as -Djunit.include=slow? I could configure my IDE runner with
that even if it does not support the categories directly.. :)

Teemu


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
